meanings.definition: the fact of surpassing all others; superiority
meanings.sent1: Her preeminence in academics earned her the top spot in the class.
meanings.sent2: The company's preeminence in the industry was well-known.
meanings.sent3: Despite his preeminence in chess, he still enjoyed playing for fun.
meanings.sent4: The preeminence of the sun in the sky was undeniable on a clear day.
meanings.sent5: The preeminence of the mountain peak made it a popular hiking destination.

meanings.definition: the quality of being distinguished or outstanding
meanings.sent1: The preeminence of her artwork was evident in the gallery.
meanings.sent2: His preeminence in leadership made him the perfect candidate for the role.
meanings.sent3: The preeminence of her baking skills always impressed her friends.
meanings.sent4: The preeminence of the diamond's sparkle caught everyone's eye.
meanings.sent5: The preeminence of the singer's voice left the audience in awe.
